comments:
!SESSION Tue Aug 03 10:27:11 EDT 2004 -----------------------------------------
-
I cannot run eclipse on XP. The platform does not start. Here is the error.
JRE is already installed. I guess it can't find boot path but i don't know 
what boot path is and how to fix it. thanks.
==========================================================
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Aug 03, 2004 10:27:11.187
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not find framework
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.getBootPath(Main.java:355)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:172)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:644)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:628)

How did you install Eclipse? Extracting on top of an existing install is
not supported, and usually causes problems. Was this the case?

Hi,

I got the same error on windows 2000 SP 4
I unpached eclipse to c:\eclipse-SDK-3.0-win32\ and start c:\eclipse-SDK-3.0-
win32\eclipse\exclipse.exe. What's wrong ?

you need to supply more info like what VM etc etc.  It must be some sort of 
local configuration issue as about 75% of the Eclipse team runs on XP so 
clearly it works.

Hi,

VM version: 1.4.2._05 (downloaded from
https://jsecom15b.sun.com/ECom/EComActionServlet/LegalPage:~:com.sun.sunit.sdlc.
content.LegalWebPageInfo;jsessionid=jsecom15b.sun.com-4497%3A4118a009%
3Ad421d98446f3871). I tryed with 1.4.1 VM but I got the same errors, so I guess 
it's not the problem of VM. This cannot be a problem of firewall (at work), 
because I've also couldn't start the programm at home (XP Windows). I 
downloaded Eclipse from http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/index.php (only SDK 
exclipse), do I need some other downloads ?

As far as I know we have only been using 1.4.2_04.  Rafael, can you see if you 
can get 1.4.2_05 (through proper channels) and confirm it runs?  Someone around 
you may already have it (e.g., JDT guys).  We want to ensure it runs for 3.0.1.

I ran with 1.4.2_05 with no problems. Tomasz, are you running with the -vm
option? The -vm option allows one to ensure which VM is being used to run
Eclipse. If you are not doing this already, please run Eclipse like this:

eclipse.exe [<any arguments you already pass to Eclipse>] -vm
<JAVA_HOME>\jre\bin\java.exe [-vmargs <any arguments you already pass to the VM>]

The sections in brackets are optional and are intended only to show you where
the -vm option should go w.r.t. any existing arguments you may already be using.

I tried adding the -vm argument but it still does not work.
Any other suggestions? Thanks...akhil

Please run the following command:

dir <eclipse_install> /s > tree.txt

and attach the resulting file to this PR. I suspect this is a duplicate of bug
35718 (not preserving directory structure when extracting install).
Akhil/Tomasz, could you do what is requested on comment 8?

Created an attachment (id=13864)
see comment 8

Hi, here the "tree.txt" file.

Which tool did you use to extract Eclipse? For some reason, it changed all
directory names to be upper-case. Winzip does not seem to behave like that. I
could easily reproduce the very same problem you are having by changing the case
of a plug-in (org.eclipse.osgi) directory.
Thanks a lot :-) Now it is working.

Thomasz, do you understand how the folders got all caps? Akhil, was your problem
the same?
Thanks a lot, Rafael. It is fine now...akhil

That is great, but it would be really interesting if we knew what caused the
problem. For instancee, what tool did you guys use to extract the Eclipse zip
file? Thanks.
Hi, I'm using an old version of norton commander. I thing I need an update :-)
